text:
The following line
  <target name="deploy-tomcat"
      depends="ready-to-deploy,,deploy-properties"/>

creates the following error. 

BUILD FAILED
Syntax Error: Depend attribute for target "null" has an empty string for dependency.

Total time: 0 seconds

It should either ignore the empty dependency, or give a meaningful error
identifying the relevant file/line
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
Mmm,
For the build file:
<project default="a">
  <target name="a"/>
  <target name="b"/>
  <target name="d" depends="a,,b"/>
</project>
I get:
Syntax Error: depends attribute of target "d" has an empty string as dependency.
for ant1.5.4, ant1.6.5 and trunk.
can you get a build file that shows the problem
creator: peterreilly@apache.org
stevel@apache.org
text:
Nothing to hand; I fixed the code. And looking at the source (Target.java) , the
only rational cause would be if a depends="" or depends=",". but why the null
target name? Does the depends attribute get set before the target name?

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: ProjectHelper2 sets the target's name before setting the dependency list since svn revision 393610, I just forgot to close the bug.
